Vučić: Pretnje sankcijama govore kako nas tretiraju

02 Nov 2019, 17:50

Predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić rekao je danas da izjava američkog izaslanika Metjua Palmera o riziku uvodjenja sankcija zbog kupovine ruske vojne opreme govore o tome kako SAD tretiraju Srbiju."Nismonabavili S-400, a za sve drugo svi oni odavno znaju i ne mislim da predstavlja bilo kakav problem. Ali i to vam govori kako nas tretiraju", rekao je Vučić za Novosti.Prema njegovim rečima, SAD imaju različite aršine za različite zemlje, a kako je dodao eventualne sankcije bi bile "potpuno neopravdane i nepravedne"."Mi ćemo voditi računa svakako, jer ne bih želeo da na bilo koji način bilo ko u Srbiji bude izložen sankcijama koje će nam uvoditi najjača svetska sila. Bez obzira što bi one bile potpuno neopravdane i nepravedne", rekao je Vučić.Specijalni predstavnik američkog državnog sekretara za Zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer izrazio je u subotu zabrinutost SAD zbog prisustva ruske vojne opreme u Srbiji i zapretio sankcijama ako Beograd nabavi ruske raketne sisteme."Postoji doza zabrinutosti zbog rasporedjivanja ruske vojne opreme na teritoriji Srbije, ali i zbog mogućnosti da Srbija traži specifične ruske sisteme. To bi vodilo riziku da joj se uvedu specifične sankcije zbog kupovine ruske vojne opreme. Nadamo se da su naši srpski partneri svesni toga", rekao je Palmer makedonskoj televiziji Alsat M.Vučića u ponedeljak očekuje susret s Palmerom.

Vucic: Sanctions threats say they treat us

02 Nov 2019, 16:50

Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said today that US envoy Matthew Palmer's statement about the risk of imposing sanctions on the purchase of Russian military equipment speaks of how the United States treats Serbia. But that also tells you how they treat us, "Vucic told the News. According to him, the US has different arches for different countries, and adding any sanctions would be" completely unjustified and unjust. " certainly, because I would not want anyone in Serbia to be exposed in any way to the sanctions imposed on us by the world's strongest power. Whatever they would be totally unjustified and unjust, "said Vucic. US Special Representative for the West The Balkans Matthew Palmer on Saturday expressed US concern over the presence of Russian military equipment in Serbia and threatened sanctions if Belgrade procured Russian missile systems. there is a concern about the deployment of Russian military equipment on the territory of Serbia, but also about the possibility of Serbia seeking specific Russian systems. This would run the risk of imposing specific sanctions on her for the purchase of Russian military equipment. We hope our Serbian partners are aware of this, "Palmer told Macedonian television Alsat M. Vucic on Monday that he is expected to meet Palmer.
